p: The MAVS pathway is preferentially targeted by viruses. For example, the hepatitis C virus serine-protease NS3/4A and the 3ABC protease of the hepatitis A virus cleave MAVS to dissociate it from its outer mitochondrial membrane base, resulting in inhibition of the pathway and thus reducing the cellular capacity to induce antiviral responses ( Li et al., 2005; Yang et al., 2007). Similarly, influenza virus protein PB1-F2 was shown to bind and impair MAVS ( Varga et al., 2012), thereby blunting the interferon response.
